0.body:
Ownership is the feature that allows Rust to make guarantees about memory safety and integrity without compromising performance. The famous borrow checker runs at compile time, and enforces Rust's ownership rules to ensure safe and fast access to data. Ownership Rules Every value has an owner
Each datum has one owner at a time
When the owner's lifetime ends, the data is released
0.title: Ownership

8.body:
A String slice is a fixed size reference to String data. fn main() { let s = String::from("hello world"); let hello = &s[0..5]; let world = &s[6..]; println!("{}, {}!", hello, world);
}
